awd_titl_txt: Characterization of Fluorescent Phosphors for Low Cost      Solar Ultraviolet Irradiance Measuring Instrumentation
awd_abstract_narration: Recent concern over the depletion of the ozone layer has                   highlighted the need for improved instrumentation for measuring                 solar ultraviolet light.  The proposed program would lead to the                development of low cost detectors with spectral sensitivities in                the UV regions of current scientific interest.  The detectors would             be based on fluorescent phosphor technology.  In Phase I of the                 program the appropriate inorganic fluorescing phosphors would be                selected and their efficiency and spectral responses fully                      characterized as a function of temperature, grain size and layer                thickness.  The final mechanical and electronic design of the                   detectors would be carried out in Phase II.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships
